snippet.title: Run The Red Carpet - Hot Ticket | GoNoodle
snippet.description:
Nothing is more exciting than a premiere...and YOU've been invited to walk, well RUN, the red carpet! But watch out -- this carpet is super active so you need to jump over dropped pearls, dodge from over-zealous camera men, and duck under body guards. Be sure to stop and snap a photo or two in front of the step & repeat along the way! Once you make it all the way down -- you'll be treated to the World Premiere of McPufferson Live! 


Create a free account on GoNoodle.com now and find hundreds of ways to move! --  https://goo.gl/fA6qK3

Have you subscribed to the GoNoodle YouTube channel? What are you waiting for!? Subscribe today for exclusive content! -- http://goo.gl/FkLrzy

snippet.title: Online Class for Kids #22 ♫ Down by the Bay ♫ Brain Breaks for Kids ♫ by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Online Class for Kids #22 by The Learning Station: Welcome to The Learning Station’s online/virtual classroom for children. Here is a list of the action, dance, brain breaks, movement, exercise and fun learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤Down by the Bay (Popular Rhyming Song for Kids)
❤Ain't it Great to be Crazy (Silly Action, Brain Break Song for Kids)
❤Ba Ba Bones (Brain Break, Movement, Dance, Exercise & Action Song for Kids)
❤ Clean Up is Fun (Cleaning Up Song for Kids.)
******************************************************************
Down by the Bay
From the CD, Nursery Rhymes with The Learning Station
by The Learning Station 
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.)
Lyrics: 
Down by the bay (Down by the bay) where the watermelons grow. (where the watermelons grow.)
Back to my home (Back to my home) I dare not go. (I dare not go.)
For if I do, (For if I do,) my mother will say, (my mother will say,)
“Have you ever seen a duck driving a truck, down by the bay?”

Down by the bay (Down by the bay) where the watermelons grow. (where the watermelons grow.)
Back to my home (Back to my home) I dare not go. (I dare not go.)
For if I do, (For if I do,) my mother will say, (my mother will say,)
“Have you ever seen a goat cruising on a boat, down by the bay?”

Down by the bay (Down by the bay) where the watermelons grow. (where the watermelons grow.)
Back to my home (Back to my home) I dare not go. (I dare not go.)
For if I do, (For if I do,) my mother will say, (my mother will say,)
“Have you ever seen a mouse building a house, down by the bay?”

Down by the bay (Down by the bay) where the watermelons grow. (where the watermelons grow.)
Back to my home (Back to my home) I dare not go. (I dare not go.)
For if I do, (For if I do,) my mother will say, (my mother will say,)
“Have you ever seen a frog dancing on a log, down by the bay?”

Down by the bay (Down by the bay) where the watermelons grow. (where the watermelons grow.)
Back to my home (Back to my home) I dare not go. (I dare not go.)
For if I do, (For if I do,) my mother will say, (my mother will say,)
“Have you ever seen a bee sipping ice tea, down by the bay?”

Down by the bay (Down by the bay) where the watermelons grow. (where the watermelons grow.)
Back to my home (Back to my home) I dare not go. (I dare not go.)
For if I do, (For if I do,) my mother will say, (my mother will say,)
“Have you ever seen a fox putting on sox, down by the bay?”
Down by the bay. Down by the bay.

Popular children’s brain breaks, action and dance song, Down by the Bay is from the award-winning CD, “Nursery Rhymes with The Learning Station”. 
Down by the Bay, enjoy our delightfully animated version of this popular nursery rhyme. From the CD, Nursery Rhymes with The Learning Station.  Nursery Rhymes with The Learning Station CD Download: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/nurseryrhymeswiththelearningstationcddownload.aspx

★ SUBSRIBE to our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheLearn...

Brain Breaks - Action Songs for Children - Dance Songs for Children - Kids Songs by The Learning Station

♫ Ain't it Great to be Crazy and Ba Ba Bones are great brain breaks, action songs for children. It makes it easy and fun to take a quick energy brain break in the classroom.  When children take a moment to sing, dance, move, and even laugh then they can return to their academics feeling happy, energized and renewed. More and more schools are realizing the significant values of brain breaks in the classroom. These brain breaks action and dance songs are perfect for the preschool, kindergarten and elementary children. Lyrics are included for ESL and EFL children’s programs.

snippet.title: Online Class #14 ♫ Brain Breaks ♫ ABC ♫ Shake Your Sillies Out ♫ Kids Songs by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Welcome to The Learning Station’s online/virtual classroom for children. Here is a list of the action, dance, brain breaks, movement, math, exercise, ABC's and learning songs we will be performing today: 
Shake Your Sillies Out (Brain Break, Movement, Dance, Exercise & Action Song for Kids)
Occupations (Brain Break, Nursery Rhyme, Dance, Exercise & Action Song for Kids)
Body Bop (Seasons Songs for Kids)
ABC Song (Brain Break, Dance, Movement, Exercise & Action Song for Kids)
❤Go Bananas, from the award-winning CD, #1 Best Kid's Songs!
#1 Best Kid's Songs CD Download: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/1bestkidssongscddow...
#1 Best Kid's Songs CD: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/bestkidssongs.aspx
New! Get this video on our DVD - Brain Breaks Action Vids for Kids / Volume Two: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/brainbreaksactionsvidsforkidsvolumetwo.aspx

❤ SUBSCRIBE to our YouTube channel today!: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheLearn... 

Go Bananas
From the CD, #1 Best Kid's Songs
by The Learning Station
℗© Monopoli/The Learning Station
Lyrics:
(Repeat each line and perform each movement with your hands and body.)
 
Form, form, form the banana. Peel, peel, peel the banana. (Form the banana by
holding your arms out straight to your side and then slowly bring them up until they
are over your head. Peel it by bringing them back down to your side.
 
Slice, slice, slice the banana. Go, go, go bananas. Go bananas! (Pretend you are
slicing with a knife and go bananas with a crazy dance.)
 
Form, form, form the potato. Peel, peel, peel the potato. (Form the potato by holding
your arms out to your side, elbows slightly bent and slowly bring them up until they
meet over your head. Peel it by bringing them back down to your side.)
 
Slice, slice, slice the potato. Mash, mash, mash the potato. Now mash! (Pretend you
are slicing with a knife and then mash by stomping your feet.)
 
Form, form, form the orange. Peel, peel, peel the orange. (Form the orange by holding
your arms out to your side, elbows slightly bent and slowly bring them up until they
meet over your head. Peel it by bringing them back down to your side.)
 
Slice, slice, slice the orange. Squeeze, squeeze, squeeze the orange. (Pretend you
are slicing with a knife. For squeeze you can either hug the person next to you or
pretend you are squishing an orange between both of your hands.)
Now squeeze!
 
Form, form, form the guitar. Play it like a rock star. (Pretend you are playing a guitar.)
Jump, jump like a rock star. Rock, rock, rock the guitar. Now rock! (Jump up and down
and rock out with your pretend guitar)
 
Form, form, form the corn. Shuck, shuck, shuck the corn. (Form the corn by holding
your arms out straight to your side and then slowly bring them up until they are over
your head. Shuck by bringing them back down to your side.)
 
Cut, cut, cut the corn. Now, pop, pop, pop the corn. Now pop! (Pretend you are
scraping the kernels off the corn and then jump around the room like popping
popcorn.)
 
Form, form, form a big ball. Kick, kick, kick the big ball. (Form the ball by holding your
arms out to your side, elbows slightly bent and slowly bring them up until they meet
over your head. Pretend to drop the ball and kick it.)                                                                                                                                        
 
Throw, throw, throw the big ball. Bounce, bounce, bounce the big ball. (Using both
hands pretend to throw a big ball and then jump up and down like a bouncing ball.)
Now bounce!
Repeat 1st verse
❤Check out our popular action, dance & nursery rhyme YouTube playlist for kids! https://goo.gl/H7gpph

❤ “Like” us on Facebook and participate in FREE giveaways galore!: https://www.facebook.com/LearningStationMusic

★ FREE Brain Boosting Music and Movement printable activity sheets: http://www.learningstationmusic.com/p... 
★ FREE Action and Dance PDF printable activity sheets: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/handouts-activities/
Schools are realizing the significant values of brain breaks in the classroom. These brain breaks, dance and storytime songs are perfect for preschoolers, kindergarten, elementary and physical education. Also featuring, dance songs, action songs and exercise songs for kids.

snippet.title: Achy Breaky Heart - NTV | GoNoodle
snippet.description:
Your Achy Breaky heart will feel all better after you boot scoot to this song!

Create a free account on GoNoodle.com now and find hundreds of ways to move! --  https://www.gonoodle.com/

Have you subscribed to the GoNoodle YouTube channel? What are you waiting for!? Subscribe today for exclusive content! -- http://goo.gl/FkLrzy

About GoNoodle
GoNoodle gets kids moving to be their strongest, bravest, silliest, smartest, bestest selves. Over 14 million kids each month are dancing, stretching, running, jumping, deep breathing, and wiggling with GoNoodle at GoNoodle.com --  https://www.gonoodle.com/

LYRICS
You can tell the world you never was my girl 
You can​ ​rip my clothes up when I'm gone 
You can tell your friends just what a fool I've been 
And laugh and joke about me on the phone 
You can tell my arms go back to the farm 
You can tell my feet to hit the floor 
Or you can tell my lips to tell my fingertips 
They won't be reaching out for you no more
But don't tell my heart 
My achy breaky heart 
I just don't think he'd understand 
And if you tell my heart 
My achy breaky heart 
He might break down inside this man 
You can tell your mom I moved to Arkansas 
You can tell your dog to ​lick my leg 
Or tell your brother Cliff that I just went and split 
He never really liked me anyway 
Or tell your Aunt Louise, tell anyone you please 
Myself already knows I'm not OK. 
Or you can tell my eyes to watch out for my mind

snippet.title: kindergarten song|Shake Your Sillies Out | Brain Breaks Songs for Kids | Kids Action Song TC zhall
snippet.description:
#ShakeYourSilliesOut #BrainBreaks
Shake Your Sillies Out (with lyrics) is a popular children's brain breaks, action song for keep da
We're gonna shake, shake, shake our sillies out, Shake, shake, shake our sillies out, Shake, shake, shake our sillies out, And wiggle our waggles away. We're gonna clap, clap, clap, our crazies out, Clap, clap, clap our crazies out, Clap, clap, clap our crazies out, And wiggle our waggles away. We're Gonna jump, jump, jump our jiggles out, Jump, jump, jump our jiggles out, Jump, jump, jump our jiggles out, And wiggle our waggles away. We're gonna jog, jog, jog our jitters out, Jog, jog, jog our jitters out, Jog, jog, jog our jitters out, And wiggle our waggles away. We're gonna stretch, stretch, stretch our stretchies out, Stretch, stretch, stretch our stretchies out, Stretch, stretch, stretch our stretchies out, And wiggle our waggles away. We're gonna yawn, yawn, yawn our yawnies out, Yawn, yawn our yawnies out, Yawn, yawn, yawn our yawnies out, And wiggle our waggles away. Repeat all, And wiggle our waggles away. Children will learn the moves to, "Shake Your Sillies Out". Your kids will have a blast with this silly and fun brain breaks action song! Shake Your Sillies Out is great for brain breaks, circle time, group activities or those bad weather days when children can't go outside to play. snippet.description:
Online Class for Kids #35 by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station): Welcome to The Learning Station’s online/virtual classroom for children. Here is a list of the action, dance, brain breaks, movement, exercise and fun learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤Princess Pat (Repeat After Me Camp Song for Kids)
❤Nursery Rhyme Dance (Action Song with Nursery Rhymes for Kids)
❤Row Row Row Your Boat (Action and Adventure Song for Kids)
❤Greetings Yoga (Greeting Handshake and Yoga Song)
**************************************************************************
Brain breaks, action, camp and dance song for kids: Princess Pat is a popular (repeat after me camp song for kids) kid’s rhyme, dance and action song. #1 Best kids action and dance songs for preschool, kindergarten & elementary.

Princess Pat (Brain breaks, action song and camp song for kids.) 
By The Learning Station®
From the CD, Brain Breaks Action Songs: Let’s Move!                                                                                                                                                              ℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.)
LYRICS:
(Activity: This is a repeat after me song. Follow the actions for the song. Have fun rhyming as you do the action and dance moves.)

The Princess Pat lived in a tree. She sailed across the seven seas.  She sailed across the channel, too. 
And she brought with her, a rick-a-bamboo. A rick-a-bamboo, now what is that?  It’s something made by the Princess Pat. It’s red and gold and purple, too. That’s why it’s called a rick-a-bamboo. 
Now, Captain Jack had a mighty fine crew. They sailed across the channel, too. 
But their ship sank and yours will too, if you don’t take a rick-a-bamboo. 
A rick-a-bamboo, now what is that?  It’s something made by the Princess Pat.  
It’s red and gold and purple, too. That’s why it’s called a rick-a-bamboo. 

The Princess Pat saw Captain Jack. She reeled him in and brought him back.  
She saved his life and his crew, too. Do you know how?  
With a rick-a-bamboo. A rick-a-bamboo, now what is that?  It’s something made by the Princess Pat.  
It’s red and gold and purple, too. That’s why it’s called a rick-a-bamboo. 
That’s why it’s called a rick-a-bamboo.

snippet.title: Freeze Dance | Freeze Dance Songs | Brain Breaks | The Bop Stop | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
The Bop Stop is one of my most popular freeze dance songs.  Children just love to dance and freeze and this super simple freeze dance song is absolutely perfect for a quick brain break to get all those wiggles out.  

Classroom teachers, parents and P.E. teachers can use this freeze dance song any time through out the day as a great brain breaks activity.  Children can follow my dance moves or be creative and do their own dance moves and freeze.  

The Bop Stop freeze dance song also helps children with listening skills and body coordination to move when the music is playing and freezing when it stops.  I purposefully made the song have a great beat, but not too fast, so little ones could more easily follow the dance moves and freeze with success.  

So, take a brain break when you need it and have fun doing the Bop Stop.

Lyrics
You can move to the beat
Shake your hands and your feet 
Do the Bop Stop

You can dance all around
Move your body to the sound
Do the Bop Stop

You can boogie, really move
You can twist really move
You can jump do the bop
But don't move when I stop

You can wiggle way down low
Let your body really go
Do the Bop Stop

You can dance really cool
Let your body really move
Do the Bop Stop

You can boogie, really move
You can twist really move
You can jump do the bop
But don't move when I stop

You can move to the beat
Shake your hands and your feet 
Do the Bop Stop
Do the Bop Stop

snippet.title: Star Wars Yoga: Saturday Morning Yoga | Cosmic Kids
snippet.description:
Star Wars Yoga: Saturday Morning Yoga | Cosmic Kids
🌈 Watch our videos ad-free on the Cosmic Kids app: https://app.cosmickids.com
⭐ Subscribe to the Cosmic Kids YouTube channel:  http://bit.ly/cosmickidsyoga 

- - - - - - - - - - - - -

To celebrate Star Wars Day this week, Jaime introduces some of our most JEDI yoga and mindfulness videos. Roll out a mat and use the force!
Have a great weekend everyone.

0:00 Star Wars | A Cosmic Kids Yoga Adventure!
A kids yoga adventure inspired by Star Wars Episode 4 - A New Hope!
Enjoy being a Jedi Knight following the hero's path in this epic yoga adventure.

24:15 Jaime's Brain Breaks | 7. Jedi Strength and Focus
A fun Jedi brain break with Jaime from Cosmic Kids!
Channel your inner Jedi and use The Force to find strength in your body and mind.

28:58 SUPER YOGA! - Stretch Safari | Fun Workout For Kids
A 5-minute fast-paced yoga-based workout for kids. Get the wiggles out and build your knowledge of all the kids yoga poses - for home, the classroom and parties! 
Copy the kids yoga poses with Jaime and score points! 
* A fun challenge for memory, coordination and information processing.*

34:16 Star Pose | The Cosmic Kids Yoga Pose Universe!
Join Jaime for a WONDERFUL kids yoga pose. Star Pose makes you feel BIG and gives a good stretch to your whole back and body. It's lovely to think about someone who needs your sparkle when you do Star Pose. ✨Who will send your sparkle to? ✨

35:56 Hero Pose | Yoga Pose Universe
Hero Pose is a wonderfully strong position - and helps you feel positive and capable. Remember to make sure your toes are pointing back when you do this one!

37:20 Peace Out Guided Relaxation for Kids | 11. Superhero Flying
Peace Out is a series of guided relaxations and visualizations for kids, written and voiced by Jaime from Cosmic Kids. 
In this guided relaxation, it's our birthday and we receive a mystery gift that gives us the superhero power of flying. Where will we go?!

- - - - - - - - - - - - -

To celebrate Star Wars Day this week, Jaime introduces some of our most JEDI yoga and mindfulness videos. Roll out a mat and use the force!
Have a great weekend everyone.

0:00 Star Wars | A Cosmic Kids Yoga Adventure!
A kids yoga adventure inspired by Star Wars Episode 4 - A New Hope!
Enjoy being a Jedi Knight following the hero's path in this epic yoga adventure.

24:15 Jaime's Brain Breaks | 7. Jedi Strength and Focus
A fun Jedi brain break with Jaime from Cosmic Kids!
Channel your inner Jedi and use The Force to find strength in your body and mind.

28:58 SUPER YOGA! - Stretch Safari | Fun Workout For Kids
A 5-minute fast-paced yoga-based workout for kids. Get the wiggles out and build your knowledge of all the kids yoga poses - for home, the classroom and parties! 
Copy the kids yoga poses with Jaime and score points! 
* A fun challenge for memory, coordination and information processing.*

34:16 Star Pose | The Cosmic Kids Yoga Pose Universe!
Join Jaime for a WONDERFUL kids yoga pose. Star Pose makes you feel BIG and gives a good stretch to your whole back and body. It's lovely to think about someone who needs your sparkle when you do Star Pose. ✨Who will send your sparkle to? ✨

35:56 Hero Pose | Yoga Pose Universe
Hero Pose is a wonderfully strong position - and helps you feel positive and capable. Remember to make sure your toes are pointing back when you do this one!

37:20 Peace Out Guided Relaxation for Kids | 11. Superhero Flying
Peace Out is a series of guided relaxations and visualizations for kids, written and voiced by Jaime from Cosmic Kids. 
In this guided relaxation, it's our birthday and we receive a mystery gift that gives us the superhero power of flying. Where will we go?!

snippet.title: Online Class #33 for Kids ♫ Science Song ♫ Brain Breaks ♫ Kids Songs by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Online Class for Kids #33 by The Learning Station: Welcome to The Learning Station’s online/virtual classroom for children. Here is a list of the action, dance, brain breaks, movement, exercise and fun learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤Science Song (Science Song for Kids )
❤Stomp and Clap (Action Song with Nursery Rhymes for Kids)
❤Alice the Camel (Cooperation, Counting Movement Song for Kids)
❤Rock n' Roll Nursery Rhymes  (Animated Nursery Rhymes)
**************************************************************************
The Science Song for Kids with Lyrics - Children’s Science Songs by The Learning Station
The Science Song by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station) is a popular children’s song that helps kids understand the definition of; hibernation, evaporation, gravity, migration and metamorphosis. This song inspires a child’s natural curiosity to explore and learn about the world around them.  The Science Song is perfect for preschoolers, kindergarten and elementary age kids.  It is also a great ESL and EFL song for children.

The Science Song                                                                                                                                                                                          From the CD, Children Love to Sing and Dance                                                                                                                                           by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station)
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station 
Lyrics:
Science, Oh, Oh, Oh
Science is a part of our everyday lives. Wonderful surprises right before your very eyes.
Say, hibernation (hibernation), evaporation (evaporation), gravity (gravity),
and metamorphosis (metamorphosis).
 Hibernation is the way some animals keep warm all day. In the cold winter months like a bear in a cave, birds fly south and that’s called migration, hibernation, migration.
Frogs are in the mud and they sleep all day. And squirrels gather nuts in the autumn days, so they can stay warm in their winter ways. When they do then that’s called hibernation.
Say, hibernation (hibernation), evaporation (evaporation), gravity (gravity),
and metamorphosis (metamorphosis).
Evaporation happens fast, it starts like a puddle but it doesn’t last. The sun comes out and it heats to steam. But you can’t see what seems to be evaporation. Evaporation, evaporation.
Say, hibernation (hibernation), evaporation (evaporation), gravity (gravity),
and metamorphosis (metamorphosis).
Gravity is a special force, it holds everything very close to the earth. Just like a magnet pulling down to the ground, and what goes up must come down. Must come down.
Say, hibernation (hibernation), evaporation (evaporation), gravity (gravity),
and metamorphosis (metamorphosis).
Metamorphosis is coming soon for the caterpillar and his cocoon. He changes to a butterfly. I don’t know. Do you know why it happens? Metamorphosis!
Say, hibernation (hibernation), evaporation (evaporation), gravity (gravity),
and metamorphosis (metamorphosis).
Science is a part of our everyday lives. Wonderful surprises right before your very eyes.
Science, Oh, Oh, Oh. Science, Oh, Oh, Oh. Science, Oh, Oh, Oh. Science, Oh, Oh, Oh.

This popular science song for kids inspires creativity, observation and imagination. “The Science Song” is from the CD, Children Love to Sing and Dance.  Children Love to Sing and Dance CD Download: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/product/children-love-to-sing-and-dance-cd-download/

snippet.title: BRAIN BREAK - ANIMAL EXERCISES - The Stepping Stone Kids
snippet.description:

Whether you need a brain break for kids in the classroom or at home, Dozer's Hip Hop is sure to get your kids up and dancing and having fun - all while learning simple adjectives such as: small, high, tall, loud, big, quiet, crazy, and silly.

snippet.title: Brain Breaks - Brain Breaks Break - Children's Song by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Brain Breaks Break, is a popular action, dance song and activity where children move to release built up energy. The new trend in classrooms is to offer children brain breaks to release anxiety and accelerate learning. 
iTunes Download: http://itunes.apple.com/album/brain-breaks-break/id617136858?i=617138205
CD Baby Download: http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/thelearningstation26

New! Get this video on our DVD - Brain Breaks Action Vids for Kids / Volume Two: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/brainbreaksactionsvidsforkidsvolumetwo.aspx

"Like" us on Facebook and participate in FREE giveaways and freebies galore!: http://www.facebook.com/LearningStationMusic

Why take brain breaks?
Brain breaks allow children the opportunity mentally rest their brain by diverting their mind into movements that allow them to:
• refresh
• recharge
• refocus
• regenerate
• release stress
• breathe
Regular brain breaks enhance attentiveness, concentration, focus and accelerate learning by allowing children to release their energy, anxiety and stress.  Brain breaks also increase circulation and promote physical fitness and coordination.  

The Learning Station has created this brain breaks action, dance song to make it easy and fun to take a quick energy break.  When children take a moment to sing, dance, move, and even laugh then they can return to their academics feeling happy, joyous, energized and renewed. More and more schools are realizing the significant values of brain breaks for both students and teachers. So take a brain break, about every 35 minutes, to get up, move, dance and release all that built-up energy and stress.

snippet.title: Online Class #40 for Kids ♫ Icky Sticky Bubble Gum ♫ Brain Breaks ♫ by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Online Class for Kids #40 by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station): Welcome to The Learning Station’s online/virtual classroom for children. Here is a list of the action, dance, brain breaks, movement, exercise and fun learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤Icky Sticky Bubble Gum (Fun, Silly Action Song)
❤Five Green and Speckled Frogs (Counting and Movement Song)
❤Raise the Ceiling (Fun, Celebratory Action Song)
❤Make New Friends (Making Friends Movement Song)
**************************************************************************
Icky Sticky Bubble Gum, is a popular activity song where children pretend that gum gets stuck to different parts of their body. Make learning fun and exciting with songs that invite active participation.  

"Icy Sticky Bubble Gum"
From the CD, "Action! Fun! Dance!"
By The Learning Station
©Monopoli/The Learning Station 

ICKY STICKY BUBBLE GUM   ℗© Copyright Monopoli/The Learning Station
(Pretend the gum is stuck to the body part in the verse of the song and then take three tries to pull it off as it gets stuck to the next body part.)
Yuck!
I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum, bubble gum, bubble gum.
I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum stuck to my hands.
So I pulled, and I pulled, and I pulled it off!  Oh NO!

I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum, bubble gum, bubble gum. 
I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum stuck my hands to my head.
So I pulled, and I pulled, and I pulled it off!  Oh NO! 
ICKY STICKY OOEY GOOEY, Bubble Gum!

I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum, bubble gum, bubble gum. 
I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum stuck my hands to my nose.
So I pulled, and I pulled, and I pulled it off!  Oh NO!

I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum, bubble gum, bubble gum. 
I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum stuck my hands to my ears.
So I pulled, and I pulled, and I pulled it off!  Oh NO!
ICKY STICKY OOEY GOOEY, Bubble Gum!

I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum, bubble gum, bubble gum. 
I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum stuck my hands to my knees.
So I pulled, and I pulled, and I pulled it off!  Oh NO!

I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum, bubble gum, bubble gum. 
I've got the icky sticky ooey gooey bubble gum stuck my hands to my hips.
So I pulled, and I pulled, and I pulled it off!  Oh NO!
ICKY STICKY OOEY GOOEY, Bubble Gum!

Oh no! I've got it stuck to my mouth. I could undo it myself, you think? 
What am I gonna do now? Oh, I can't talk anymore! Oh, I don't like this at all.

snippet.title: Online Class for Kids #25 ♫ Brain Breaks ♫ Iggle Wiggle ♫  Kids Songs by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Online Class  for Kids #25: Welcome to The Learning Station’s online/virtual classroom for children. Here is a list of the action, dance, brain breaks, movement, fun and learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤Iggle Wiggle (Brain Break, Movement, Dance, Exercise & Action Song for Kids)
❤Who Stole the Cookies (Sequencing, Silly Inquiry Song for Kids)
❤From Your Seat (Brain Break, Movement, Exercise & Action Song for Kids)
❤ I'm a Little Teapot (Sing Along and Movement Song for Kids)
******************************************************************
Your children will learn the FUN moves to the HIT “repeat after me” camp song, Iggle Wiggle. Iggle Wiggle is also a very popular brain breaks and action song for kids. Your kids will have a musical blast with this silly and fun action, camp song! This camp song is a “repeat after me” movement song making it easy for children to learn the actions. Iggle Wiggle is great for brain breaks, circle time, group activities, music and movement, or those bad weather days when children can't go outside to play. 

Iggle Wiggle makes it makes it easy and fun to take a quick energy brain break in the classroom.  More and more schools are realizing the significant values of brain breaks, action songs in the classroom. This brain breaks, action song is perfect for the preschool, kindergarten and elementary children. Lyrics are included for early readers, ESL and EFL programs for children.

Iggle Wiggle                                                                                                                                                                                From the CD, Brain Breaks Action Songs: Let’s Move!
by The Learning Station
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station 
(Dance and move to all the action and dance movements called out in the “repeat after me” verses).

Can you iggle? Can you wiggle? Can you jump back and giggle?
Can you dance? Can you strut? Can you bark like a mutt?
Woof Woof, Woof Woof Woof, Woof Woof Woof Woof Woof
Yes, we can iggle. We can wiggle. We can jump back and giggle.
We can dance. We can strut. We can bark like a mutt.
Woof Woof, Woof Woof Woof, Woof Woof Woof Woof Woof
But can you smile? Can you frown? Can you laugh like a clown?
Can you swim? Can you surf? Can you sing like a smurf?
La La La La La La, La La La La La
Yes, we can smile. We can frown. We can laugh like a clown.
We can swim. We can surf. We can sing like a smurf.
La La La La la La, La La La La La
But can you rake? Can you shake? Can you do the snake?
Can you tap? Can you clap? Can you bust out in a rap?
Yo yo yo yo yeah-ah, Yo yo yo yo.
Yes, we can rake. We can shake. We can do the snake.
We can tap. We can clap. We can bust out in a rap.
Yo yo yo yo yeah-ah, Yo yo yo yo.
But can you dig? Can you spin? Can you dive right in?
Can you sing? Hold a note...LAAAAAAAAAAAAAA?
Can you row row your boat?
Row row row your boat gently down the stream?
Yes, we can dig. We can spin. We can dive right in.
We can sing. Hold a note...LAAAAAAAAAAAAAA.
We can row, row, row your boat
gently down the stream
But can you skip? Can you jog? Can you jump like a frog?
Can you stretch? Can you twist? Can you blow me a kiss?
Smack smack smack, etc.
Yes, we can skip. We can jog. We can jump like a frog.
We can stretch. We can twist. We can blow you a kiss.
Smack smack smack, etc.

Popular children’s brain breaks, camp, action and dance song, Iggle Wiggle.  From the CD, Brain Breaks Action Songs: Let’s Move!  Brain Breaks Action Songs: Let’s Move! CD Download: http://store.learningstationmusic.com...

Go Bananas
From the CD, #1 Best Kid's Songs!
by The Learning Station
℗© Monopoli/The Learning Station
Lyrics:
Go Bananas 
(Repeat each line and perform each movement with your hands and body.)

Form, form, form the banana. Peel, peel, peel the banana. (Form the banana by
holding your arms out straight to your side and then slowly bring them up until they
are over your head. Peel it by bringing them back down to your side.

Slice, slice, slice the banana. Go, go, go bananas. Go bananas! (Pretend you are
slicing with a knife and go bananas with a crazy dance.)

Form, form, form the potato. Peel, peel, peel the potato. (Form the potato by holding
your arms out to your side, elbows slightly bent and slowly bring them up until they
meet over your head. Peel it by bringing them back down to your side.)

Slice, slice, slice the potato. Mash, mash, mash the potato. Now mash! (Pretend you
are slicing with a knife and then mash by stomping your feet.)

Form, form, form the orange. Peel, peel, peel the orange. (Form the orange by holding
your arms out to your side, elbows slightly bent and slowly bring them up until they
meet over your head. Peel it by bringing them back down to your side.)

Slice, slice, slice the orange. Squeeze, squeeze, squeeze the orange. (Pretend you
are slicing with a knife. For squeeze you can either hug the person next to you or

Here We Go Loopty Loo
From the CD, “Here We Go Loopty Loo”
By The Learning Station 
℗© Monopoli/The Learning Station

snippet.title: Nursery Rhymes | Nursery Rhymes Song | Brain Breaks | Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star is a traditional poem or song for young children. The repetition  and rhyming in Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star is helpful in teaching kids how language development works. Kids love to sing and dance along with the Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star with all the characters they know and love.

Nursery Rhymes help with a child’s language development. Kids hear and say vowel and letter sounds repeatedly throughout the song, Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star.   Nursery rhymes are filled with alliteration. As they sing a nursery rhyme they get a sense for rhythm and can help develop other important language skills such as inflection.
 
Nursery Rhymes are also important as they are often where a child hears a word for the first time, building their vocabulary. Nursery rhymes are also a great introduction to sentence and story structure because they are short and easy to remember, making them repeatable, too. Nursery rhymes are good for simple story telling as they usually have an identifiable beginning, middle and end. Kids easily memorize and recall the stories, especially when the nursery rhymes are set to music.

Nursery rhymes can build a child’s imagination as they need to visualize and often act out scenes in the nursery rhymes. Humpty Dumpty is a great example. Nursery rhymes such as Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star can help kids with developing gross and fine motor movements.

What you may not know is nursery rhymes can also help develop math skills as well. Many nursery rhymes involve the use of number, such as three blind mice, but also nursery rhymes rely on patterning and sequence. Math vocabulary words for measurement can also be introduced, for instance weight. Research also supports the assertion that music and rhyme increase a child's ability in spatial reasoning.

Nursery rhymes also aid kids in developing socially as the characters in nursery rhymes are often portrayed in a variety of situations. These situations teach children about understanding their emotions and the emotion of others and how to identify what these emotions are.

LYRICS:
Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star

Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are
Up above the world so high
Like a diamond in the sky
Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are

Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are
Up above the world so high
Like a diamond in the sky
Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are

Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are
Up above the world so high
Like a diamond in the sky
Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are

snippet.title: Brain Break Walking Bridge for teachers and counselors
snippet.description:
Here is a short video of using a walking bridge in Big Bear, CA for teachers/counselors to use with kids for a brain break. The music in the video has no words. Hope lots of kids enjoy this video. (I made it for my sister's students.)


Music: https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music
Royalty Free Music from Bensound
tags: brain break for counselors and teachers
